meanings.definition: A hollow part or piece for receiving and holding something
meanings.sent1: The toolbox had small sockets to store the screws.
meanings.sent2: She placed the key in the socket to open the door.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the tree hollow as a cozy socket for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The mountain acted as a giant socket, cradling the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The cupcake holder had individual sockets for each sweet treat.

meanings.definition: A receptacle into which an electric plug can be inserted
meanings.sent1: The power strip had multiple sockets for all the devices.
meanings.sent2: He plugged the lamp into the wall socket to light up the room.
meanings.sent3: The overloaded socket sparked and sputtered, causing a blackout.
meanings.sent4: The socket hummed softly as the appliance drew power.
meanings.sent5: She carefully inserted the plug into the socket to charge her phone.

meanings.definition: A means of transmitting data between a computer and a network
meanings.sent1: The ethernet socket allowed fast data transfer between devices.
meanings.sent2: He checked the network settings to troubleshoot the socket issue.
meanings.sent3: The data socket seemed to have a mind of its own, sending files randomly.
meanings.sent4: The digital socket acted as a bridge connecting the computer to the internet.
meanings.sent5: She clicked on the socket icon to establish a secure connection.

meanings.definition: A joint or connecting point where two parts come together
meanings.sent1: The mechanic tightened the socket to secure the pipes together.
meanings.sent2: The socket between the bones allowed for smooth movement of the joint.
meanings.sent3: The Lego pieces clicked together perfectly, forming a sturdy socket.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a strong socket, keeping them connected through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces interlocked, creating a seamless socket between them.
